column4: okay, do I need to ask my question a fourth time or is everyone here clueless? =/
what is your question? (problably im clueless as well)
sudo rm -rf /lib/modules/`uname -r`/kernel/sound probably this removed your hardware drivers for sound hehe.. so it did what was supposed to do
did you restore them?
i did all of what the guide said, so i'm not sure, lemme try the last part again
try it. maybe something went wrong
and by the way `uname -r` is for the kernel you are running. the howto is wrong. it should have `uname -r` for the kernel below he is reinstalling, and he assumes 2.6.28
it didn't install properly, it couldn't find any of the packages
uname -r please
ah, so it's trying to install the wrong file?
yes most probably. I will try to give you the right instruction. hold on
sudo aptitude reinstall linux-headers-`uname -r` linux-image-`uname -r` linux-restricted-modules-`uname -r`
this should do the trick
k
i think i got it now, thanx for suggestion the uname -r input ;)
yeah, no problem. maybe you should comment in that thread for fixing the howto. it is definitely misleading
glad to help you
I think its working, its downloading a file right now instead of doing nothing like last time =P
nice! :D
rebooting, will tell you the outcome in a bit
ok
I continued with the rest of the instructions, but still no luck... the hardware is added again though, so its progress =)
at least you have drivers :p .. but did you unmute the sound?
